div1.head: Jim to Mr. Paul Rockwell July 22nd 1915
div1.p: I was awfully glad to hear from you last night, but mighty sorry to learn about the Americans in the Iur. That’s a hell of a stiff percentage. Sorry Kiffin has to go back so soon. Yes I read about Weeks some time ago.

Just at present I haven’t time for a regular letter, but I want to get these — few — lines off with a request that you let me know what your plans are as soon as you can after you pass the Commission. I can get a six or seven day permission either in August or September, tho [sic] I am not sure about August. At any rate as soon as I hear from you I will fix a time for taking my leave. You see if you are going to pull of [off] the marriage in the Fall I can wait until then and if not I want to go in as soon as I can. So please let me know as quickly as possible what your plans are after you get your status doped out. The whole bunch out here is waiting turn on permission. The telephonists at the trench switch boards are starting in cahque a sa tour, to day, and the Artillerymen are on the move. As only one goes at a time
it will be long before they all get a look in.

No word from Johnson or Rumsey. Tho [sic] I know they’re up around Dunkirk. Harrison went back to America sometime ago. Our chef Ned Salisbury is in Paris for eight days at present. Queer, it had been quiet for almost eight days before he left. An hour after we commenced to get it. To day it started in again and stopped a few minutes ago. Up around the trenches all is fairly quiet save for the occasional shots and in the lines crapoullot and grenades.

Mighty nice of you to ask me to put up at the hotel with you when I go in. My clothes are at the Ambulance, tho, [sic] and grub stake, but maybe we can arrange a deal. I want to see a lot of you that’s all. Will drop you another line damn soon. Got to get some sleep after a wash up and the time’s short. Anon mon “compain” Don’t worry, On les ora, les salauds! You’re right about the States. Its disgusting the way they’re doing. Up to two months ago they were making but 1/20 eu [sic] of 1 percent of the ammunition. Mais maintenant ca marche mieux.
